intro: Elephantopus nudiflorus, commonly known as the nakedflower elephantopus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest margins. Its leaves are usually alternate and can be either simple or lobed, depending on the species. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, often grouped into clusters that resemble a single bloom.
